solution_line_template: 5 hours in the studio is the same as {studio_hours} * {minutes_per_hour} = <<{studio_hours}*{minutes_per_hour}={total_studio_minutes}>>{total_studio_minutes} minutes.
To record all of his songs, Elvis takes {minutes_per_song_record} * {num_songs} = <<{minutes_per_song_record}*{num_songs}={total_recording_minutes}>>{total_recording_minutes} minutes.

After editing and recording {total_studio_minutes} - {total_recording_minutes} - {total_editing_minutes} = <<{total_studio_minutes}-{total_recording_minutes}-{total_editing_minutes}={remaining_writing_minutes}>>{remaining_writing_minutes} minutes are left to write all of his songs.
Songwriting therefore took {remaining_writing_minutes} / {num_songs} = <<{remaining_writing_minutes}/{num_songs}={minutes_per_song_write}>>{minutes_per_song_write} minutes per song.
